text: Hwang Ye-ji (; born May 26, 2000), known mononymously as Yeji, is a South Korean singer and dancer. She is the leader of the South Korean girl group Itzy, formed by JYP Entertainment in 2019. Yeji released her debut extended play (EP), Air, in March 2025. == Early life == Hwang Ye-ji was born on May 26, 2000, in Seoul, South Korea, and grew up in Jeonju. While in elementary school she took an interest in dancing, and joined a local dance group. She attended high school at Jeonju Commercial Information High School. == Career == === 2015–2018: Pre-debut === In 2015, Yeji passed her audition to join JYP Entertainment as a trainee by performing Twice's song "Like Ooh-Ahh". In 2017, Yeji appeared on the first episode of Stray Kids, alongside her future groupmates Ryujin, Chaeryeong, and Yuna. In 2018, Yeji participated in SBS' The Fan, where she was referred to as "JYP’s Secret Weapon". === 2019–present: Itzy and solo debut === Yeji officially debuted with Itzy in February 2019, with the release of their first single album, It'z Different, and a music video for its lead single "Dalla Dalla". In December 2023, Yeji released a music video for her solo track "Crown On My Head". In December 2024, Yeji released her first OST, "Think about you", for the romantic comedy series Love Your Enemy. In January 2025, it was announced that Yeji was preparing for her solo debut. In March, Yeji released her first EP, Air, and a music video for its lead single of the same name. == Discography == See the main article: Itzy ===Extended plays=== Title Details Air * Scheduled: March 10, 2025 * Label: JYP * Formats: CD, digital download, streaming ===Composition credits=== Title Year Artist Album Composer Lyricist "Crown On My Head" 2024 Yeji Born to Be === Soundtrack Appearances === Title Year Album "Think About You" 2024 Love Your Enemy OST == Videography == === Television shows === Title Year Role Notes Stray Kids 2017 Participant Appeared in episode 1 The Fan 2018 Contestant Eliminated in the 5th episode Universe Ticket 2023 Mentor == References == Category:2000 births Category:Itzy members Category:JYP Entertainment artists Category:K-pop singers Category:Living people Category:Singers from Seoul
title: Yeji (singer)
